member.summary: The DICOM object is a container for DICOM elements. It contains methods for finding elements easily from within the structure.

member.summary: Contructor
member.param: a list of elements to be included in the object

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.Add(EvilDICOM.Core.Interfaces.IDICOMElement)
member.summary: Adds an element to the DICOM object
member.param: a DICOM element to be added

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindAll(EvilDICOM.Core.Enums.VR)
member.summary: Finds all DICOM elements that match a VR type
member.returns: a list of all elements that meet the search criteria
member.param: the VR type to find

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindAll``1
member.summary: Finds all DICOM elements that match an element type
member.returns: a list of all elements that are strongly typed

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindAll(System.String)
member.summary: Finds all DICOM elements that match a certain tag
member.returns: a list of all elements that meet the search criteria
member.param: the tag to find

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindAll(EvilDICOM.Core.Element.Tag)
member.summary: Finds all DICOM elements that match a certain tag
member.returns: a list of all elements that meet the search criteria
member.param: the tag to find

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindAll(System.String[])
member.summary: Finds all DICOM elements that are embedded in the DICOM structure in some particular location. This location is defined by descending tags from the outer most elements to the element. It is not necessary to include every tag in the descending "treelike" structure. Branches can be skipped.
member.returns: a list of all elements that meet the search criteria
member.param: a string array containing in order the tags from the outer most elements to the element being searched for

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindAll(EvilDICOM.Core.Element.Tag[])
member.summary: Finds all DICOM elements that are embedded in the DICOM structure in some particular location. This location is defined by descending tags from the outer most elements to the element. It is not necessary to include every tag in the descending "treelike" structure. Branches can be skipped.
member.returns: a list of all elements that meet the search criteria
member.param: a tag array containing in order the tags from the outer most elements to the element being searched for

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindFirst(System.String)
member.summary: Finds the first element in the entire DICOM structure that has a certain tag
member.returns: one single DICOM element that is first occurence of the tag in the structure
member.param: the tag to be searched

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.FindFirst(EvilDICOM.Core.Element.Tag)
member.summary: Finds the first element in the entire DICOM structure that has a certain tag
member.returns: one single DICOM element that is first occurence of the tag in the structure
member.param: the tag to be searched

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.Replace``1(``0)
member.summary: Replaces a current instance of the DICOM element in the DICOM object. If the object does not exist, this method exits. For this scenario, please use ReplaceOrAdd().
member.param: the instance of the element

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.ReplaceOrAdd``1(``0)
member.summary: Replaces a current instance of the DICOM element in the DICOM object. If the object does not exist, this method will add it to the object.
member.param: the instance of the element

member.summary: The list of first level DICOM elements inside this DICOM object

member.name: P:EvilDICOM.Core.DICOMObject.AllElements
member.summary: The list of all DICOM elements at every level in the DICOM structure (includes sub-elements of sequences)

member.name: T:EvilDICOM.Core.Dictionaries.VRDictionary
member.summary: General purpose class for working with VRs. It contains methods to convert ASCII string abbreviations into VR type, the reverse, and a few more useful methods when working with VR enums.

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.Dictionaries.VRDictionary.GetVRFromAbbreviation(System.String)
member.summary: Finds the VR type from an DICOM two letter abbreviation.
member.param: an DICOM two letter abbreviation

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.Dictionaries.VRDictionary.GetAbbreviationFromVR(EvilDICOM.Core.Enums.VR)
member.summary: Creates the DICOM two letter abbreviation from a VR type.
member.param: the VR type

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.Dictionaries.VRDictionary.GetVRFromType(EvilDICOM.Core.Interfaces.IDICOMElement)
member.summary: Finds the VR enum from a specific DICOM element.
member.param: the DICOM element

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.Dictionaries.VRDictionary.GetAbbreviationFromType(EvilDICOM.Core.Interfaces.IDICOMElement)
member.summary: Finds the VR enum from a specific DICOM element.
member.param: the DICOM element

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.Dictionaries.VRDictionary.GetEncodingFromVR(EvilDICOM.Core.Enums.VR)
member.summary: Determines the encoding, meaning how many bytes to write the VR and length parameters, from a VR type. Options are explicit long (8 bytes), explicit short (4 bytes), or implicit (4 bytes). In UAB.RadOnc.Blazer, the null VR is used to represent an unknown VR (before dictionary lookup) that is implicitly encoded.
member.returns: the encoding method for this type
member.param: the VR type

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.IO.Data.DataPadder.PadNull(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Pads null bytes around the data to make it even

member.name: M:EvilDICOM.Core.IO.Data.DataPadder.PadSpace(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Pads a space character around the data to make it even
